titleStmt.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton, June 14, 1883

bibl.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: that Mr. du Verge has applied to the Department to have me substituted, but on what ground I am unable to say.

In submitting the foregoing matter for the information of the Department, I have the honour to request that should there be no reason why I should not continue to hold the post of Vice Consul, that Mr. du Verge should be instructed to consign the archives of the Consulate to my charge whenever he may absent himself, and should it be deemed expedient, to call upon him to explain his reasons for showing such discourtesy to me and am not his inferior save in Official rank.

I have the honour to be
Sir
Your most obedient servant
Robt S. Newton
U.S. Vice Consul
